memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, offload_package *offload_data, real **B_offload_array, real **E_offload_array, real **plasma_offload_array, real **neutral_offload_array, real **wall_offload_array, int **wall_int_offload_array, real **boozer_offload_array, real **mhd_offload_array, real **asigma_offload_array, real **offload_array, int **int_offload_array)
memberdef.name: pack_offload_array

briefdescription.para: Prepare offload array to be offloaded.

detaileddescription.para: When data is read, it is stored to input specific offload arrays which are packed as a single array here (two actually as one array contains integers and the other floats). The initial individual arrays are deallocated.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to common offload array created here
pointer to common offload integer array created here

memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, int mpi_size, int mpi_rank, int n_tot, input_particle **pin, particle_state **pout, int *nprts, real *B_offload_array)
memberdef.name: prepare_markers

detaileddescription.para: Marker states are initialized here and stored in a single array, which then can be offloaded to the target.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to marker input array which is deallocated here
pointer to marker state array created here
pointer to variable for number of markers for this process
pointer to magnetic field data needed for marker init

memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, int mpi_size, int mpi_rank, int mpi_root, int n_tot, particle_state *ps, char *qid)
memberdef.name: write_rungroup

briefdescription.para: Create and store run group and marker inistate.

parameterdescription.para: marker state array for this process
unique identifier for this run group

memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, int mpi_size, int mpi_rank, int mpi_root, int n_tot, int nprts, particle_state *pin, offload_package *offload_data, real *offload_array, int *int_offload_array, int *n_gathered, particle_state **pout, real **diag_offload_array)
memberdef.name: offload_and_simulate

briefdescription.para: Offload data to target, carry out the simulation, and return to host.

parameterdescription.para: number of markers in this process
marker state array for this process (deallocated here)
packed offload array containing the input data
packed offload integer array containg the input data
pointer for storing number of simulated markers
pointer to array containing all marker endstates
allocated array to return output data from target

memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, int mpi_rank, int mpi_root, particle_state *ps_gathered, int n_gathered, real *diag_offload_array)
memberdef.name: write_output

parameterdescription.para: rank of the root process (which does the writing)
marker state array containing the end states

briefdescription.para: Writes a summary of what happened to the markers during simulation.

detaileddescription.para: This function writes a summary of marker end conditions and possible simulation-time errors. Since simulation can have billions and billions of markers, we only show how many markers had specific error or end condition.
End conditions and errors are printed in human-readable format.

parameterdescription.para: array of marker states after simulation has finished
number of markers in the array

briefdescription.para: Functions to execute main program externally.

detaileddescription.para: The main progam for ascot5 is in ascot5_main.c. This header file declares the functions needed to carry out the simulation, so that hey can be used by an external program (i.e. via the python interface).
